content.question: Which of the following best explains a reason that a president might use a signing statement to express displeasure with a bill as opposed to issuing a veto?

choices.label: The president may have objections to provisions of a bill but does not want to risk Congress overriding a veto.
Congress has severely curtailed the power of the president to withhold funds for bills that have been adopted.
The Supreme Court is hesitant to acknowledge the president’s power to veto legislation.
The president wants to ensure executive agencies do not spend the money appropriated by Congress.

content.answer: The president may have objections to provisions of a bill but does not want to risk Congress overriding a veto.
